properties.name: camel.component.dapr.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.binding-name
properties.description: The name of the Dapr binding to invoke

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.binding-operation
properties.description: The operation to perform on the binding

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.client
properties.description: The Dapr Client. The option is a io.dapr.client.DaprClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.concurrency
properties.description: Concurrency mode to use with state operations

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.config-keys
properties.description: List of keys for configuration operation

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.config-store
properties.description: The name of the Dapr configuration store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.configuration
properties.description: The component configurations. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.dapr.DaprConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.consistency
properties.description: Consistency level to use with state operations

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.content-type
properties.description: The contentType for the Pub/Sub component to use.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.e-tag
properties.description: The eTag for optimistic concurrency during state save or delete operations

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the dapr component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.expiry-in-seconds
properties.description: The expiry time in seconds for the lock

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.http-extension
properties.description: HTTP method to use when invoking the service. Accepts verbs like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc. Creates a minimal HttpExtension with no headers or query params. Takes precedence over verb. The option is a io.dapr.client.domain.HttpExtension type.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.key
properties.description: The key used to identify the state/secret object within the specified state/secret store

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.lock-operation
properties.description: The lock operation to perform on the store. Required for DaprOperation.lock operation

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.lock-owner
properties.description: The lock owner identifier for the lock

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.method-to-invoke
properties.description: The name of the method or route to invoke on the target service

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.preview-client
properties.description: The Dapr Preview Cliet. The option is a io.dapr.client.DaprPreviewClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.pub-sub-name
properties.description: The name of the Dapr Pub/Sub component to use. This identifies which underlying messaging system Dapr will interact with for publishing or subscribing to events.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.resource-id
properties.description: The resource Id for the lock

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.secret-store
properties.description: The name of the Dapr secret store to interact with, defined in local-secret-store.yaml config

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.service-to-invoke
properties.description: Target service to invoke. Can be a Dapr App ID, a named HTTPEndpoint, or a FQDN/public URL

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.state-operation
properties.description: The state operation to perform on the state store. Required for DaprOperation.state operation

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.state-store
properties.description: The name of the Dapr state store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.store-name
properties.description: The lock store name

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.topic
properties.description: The name of the topic to subscribe to. The topic must exist in the Pub/Sub component configured under the given pubsubName.

properties.name: camel.component.dapr.verb
properties.description: The HTTP verb to use for invoking the method
